title: Who is Rebekah Vardy, does she have children and what is her net worth?
text:
It’s all kicking off (Picture: S Meddle/ITV/REX)

Rebekah Vardy has been accused by Coleen Rooney of selling fake stories about her to the media.

Coleen, wife of footballer Wayne Rooney, made the accusations on Instagram and claims to have screenshots to back up her claims.

Rebekah has however denied these allegations.

As we sip some tea and wait for more drama to unfold, here’s what you need to know about Rebekah and exactly what Coleen said about her.

Who is Rebekah Vardy?

Rebekah is Leicester footballer Jamie Vardy’s wife.

They met in 2014 when Rebekah was working as a nightclub promoter on Jamie’s birthday

The two married in 2016 and they have two children together – Sofia (four) and Finlay (two) – and Rebekah is currently pregnant with another child.

Rebekah, 37, also has two children – Megan (13) and Taylor (nine) – from previous relationships.

Jamie, 32, has another daughter, Ella (thought to be born in 2010), from his previous relationship with Emma Daggett.

Rebekah has become a regular fixture on chat shows like Good Morning Britain, This Morning and Loose Women.

She has also appeared on Celebrity Gogglebox and I’m A Celebrity…Get Me Out Of Here! in 2017, where she was the third person eliminated that season.

Rebekah’s precise net worth isn’t known, however Jamie’s amounts to £9.8million.

What exactly did Coleen Rooney say about Rebekah Vardy?

Coleen, 33, said that she posted ‘a series of false stories’ after blocking all but one of her followers from viewing her Instagram account.

She wrote in an Instagram post: ‘For a few years now someone I trusted to follow me on my personal Instagram account has been consistently informing The Sun newspaper of my private posts and stories.

‘There has been so much information given to them about me, my friends and my family – all without my permission or knowledge.

‘After a long time of trying to figure out who it could be, for various reasons, I had a suspicion.

This has been a burden in my life for a few years now and finally I have got to the bottom of it…… pic.twitter.com/0YqJAoXuK1 — Coleen Rooney (@ColeenRoo) October 9, 2019

‘To try and prove this, I came up with an idea. I blocked everyone from viewing my Instagram stories except ONE account. (Those on my private account must have been wondering why I haven’t had stories on there for a while.)’

She continued: ‘Over the past five months I have posted a series of false stories to see if they made their way into the Sun newspaper. And you know what, they did! The story about gender selection in Mexico, the story about returning to TV and then the latest story about the basement flooding in my new house.

‘It’s been tough keeping it to myself and not making any comment at all, especially when the stories have been leaked, however I had to. Now I know for certain which account/individual it’s come from.

‘I have saved and screenshotted all the original stories which clearly show just one person has viewed them. It’s…… Rebekah Vardy’s account.’

Coleen also shared the post on Twitter, with a caption that reads: ‘This has been a burden in my life for a few years now and finally I have got to the bottom of it……’

Coleen made her accusations publically (Picture: Max Mumby/Indigo/Getty Images)

Rebekah released a statement in response, writing: ‘As I have just said to you on the phone, I wish you had called me if you thought this. I never speak to anyone about you as various journalists who have asked me over the years can vouch for.

‘If you thought this was happening you could have told me & I could have changed my passwords to see if it stopped. Over the years various people have had access to my Insta and just this week I found I was following people I didn’t know and have never followed myself.’

The WAG and reality star continued: ‘I’m not being funny but I don’t need the money, what would I gain from selling stories on you? I liked you a lot Coleen and I’m so upset that you have chosen to do this, especially when I’m heavily pregnant.

‘I’m disgusted that I’m even having to deny this. You should have called me the first time this happened.’

Metro.co.uk has contacted Rebekah’s rep for further comment.
